text: Rodney Clark "Hot Rod" Hundley (October 26, 1934 â€“ March 27, 2015) was an American professional basketball player and television broadcaster. He played for the Los Angeles Lakers from 1957 to 1963. He later became known as a broadcaster for the Utah Jazz. Hundley was born in Charleston, West Virginia. Hundley died of Alzheimer's disease at his home in Phoenix, Arizona, aged 80. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Los Angeles Lakers players Category:American television personalities Category:People from Charleston, West Virginia Category:Sportspeople from West Virginia
title: Rod Hundley
